### Overview

- Today's lecture is about the statistical aspects of genetics and how we can link traits (e.g., height, blood pressure, disease) to specific genetic variants
- We'll go into some depth concerning the most commonly used mathematical / statistical models for genetics, and briefly touch on more complex extensions
- In addition, we'll discuss how this works at the genome-wide scale and what has been learned from the collective efforts to do so ---
